alert.note: Alert for Hardeman; McNairy (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 3:19PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Marshall, Tippah, Benton, Alcorn, Hardeman, McNairy and southwestern Chester Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 319 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Silerton to 8 miles northwest of Pocahontas to near Canaan to near Snow Lake Shores. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Corinth, Holly Springs, Bolivar, Ripley, Selmer, Big Hill Pond State Park, Lamar, Adamsville, Blue Mountain, Snow Lake Shores, Silerton, Masseyville, Theo, Canaan, Pocahontas, Hinkle, Gravestown, Robertson, McNairy and Walnut. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
